## Plotting US states and territories

Data from ESRI [ArcGIS Hub](https://hub.arcgis.com/datasets/TrainingServices::us-state-boundaries/explore?location=24.148743%2C-65.721188%2C3.01)

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(sf)

#read in spatial data
allStates<-st_read(("US_State_Boundaries.shp"))

#plot it
ggplot()+
  geom_sf(data=allStates)
```

## With tigris package

```{r}
#install.packages(tigris)
library(tigris)

#filter to create a new dataset with 50 States (no territories)
fiftyStates<-allStates %>% 
  filter(OBJECTID %in% c(1:25,28:60))

#Offset AK and HI using shift_geometry function from tigris
fiftyStatesShifted<-shift_geometry(fiftyStates,position=c("below"))

#plot new map
ggplot()+
  geom_sf(data=fiftyStatesShifted)

```
